text: The Delfonics was an American R&B;/soul music group from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. The Delfonics were most popular in the late 1960s and early 1970s. Their best known songs are "La-La (Means I Love You)", "Didn't I (Blow Your Mind This Time)", "Break Your Promise", "I'm Sorry", and "Ready or Not Here I Come (Can't Hide from Love)". Their songs have been used in movie soundtracks, including Quentin Tarantino's 1997 movie Jackie Brown. Their songs "Ready or Not Here I Come (Can't Hide from Love)" and "Funny Feeling" were used in the video game Grand Theft Auto V. ==References== Category:Musicians from Philadelphia Category:American R&B; bands Category:American soul bands
title: The Delfonics
